Text.Text: Look, *mercenary,* if you have any goblin wounds you need me to tend, fine, but I'm in no mood for any more cases of frostbite, understand?

I?  I am Nolan.  I'm the... healer here at the Palisade.  If you're in need of serious healing, however, I'd head to the Pavilion inside the gates - those two blustering war-priests can help you more than I could.
So... you have returned.  Are you in need of healing or are you simply stepping in to shake off the cold?
Yes?

That so?  Well, look now, before you get any ideas in your head, my healing's no substitute for proper *rest,* understand?  Any spellcasters with you aren't going to have their heads cleared to cast more spells... I just tend the wounds of the body, not the spirit.

Indeed, I am in the service of Waukeen... I was shipped to Targos as "penance" by my superior, Quinn Silverfinger.  That little runt *claimed* greed ran too thickly in my blood... so I was sent here to seek out "new trade routes."  Ridiculous pretense from a ridiculous halfing!

In any event, since my attempts to convert the local drunks, barbarians, and those damned nature worshippers in the south to see the *possibilities* of trade have proven all but worthless, my job is to help the Targos Guard and try to keep the men from bleeding to death from a goblin arrow.
So this filthy shack is now my base of operations... if you're in need of any healing, you'll find me here.

Yes, and that's one order I didn't mind following.  The best place for a healer or spellcaster is *here* if goblin arrows start flying.  I'm no soldier, and my health isn't nearly half that of a real fighter.

Hmmph.  Well, I don't have the time or patience to debate it with *you,* but I'll grant you this: While I don't care much for nature priests... or even rangers in general... I'm glad you're here right now, and any others you bring would be welcome.

There's at least one tribe in the area, but that's all we know.  Now, I'll be the first to admit I don't care much for nature priests and their penniless ways... or even rangers... but I wouldn't mind having a few on our side right now.

We could use more men that know the lands surrounding Targos... or at least are more in tune with nature.  Their tracking skills could help us find the goblin camp... maybe even use their magic to enlist some of the tundra animals to tear those goblins apart - *that'd* be something to see indeed.

Yes, well... now, understand I don't bear any love for their questionable faith and *total* disregard for wealth and trade, but I've seen druids... and experienced rangers... cause the ground to sprout vines and tangle up an entire horde of goblins.  That little Entangling enchantment makes goblins quite easy pickings for archers.

I've seen druids and rangers turn wolves right back on their masters with just the right look - charming them where they stand.  I'd love to have some of those fellows around if any goblin wolves jump the walls... a dead goblin who's been killed by one of his own hounds is worth its weight in gold.

Hmm.  In mercenary companies in the south, there was nothing better than a wizard with Sleep magic - even *one* of those spells can turn the tide of battle if you get a clump of enemies together.  Goblins, orcs, wolves... they all just lie down and take a nap - and you can put them to sleep permanently with a hammer to the skull.

Til' then, though, we have to make do with Oswald's bottles of flaming oil - that's good enough for scattering goblins when there are no mages about.  There should be a flask or two in one of the crates in here, if you - hmmph - haven't plundered them already.

Well, that slip of an elven woman, Ulbrec's wife, probably sells some of those Sleep scrolls to anyone who can cast them... and that little gnomish idiot, Oswald, probably has some more flaming oil he's cooked up.

Also, those war-priests Denham and Ragni may have some scrolls and potions from the temple treasury for sale in the Pavilion; I would check with them, too.  As for anything that can charm animals, you'd need someone who has that particular skill - and it's not me.
Shawford's right over there - if you've got business with him, then don't let me keep you from it.
The dwarf?  Well, last I heard Olap was at the northeast Palisade - you should find him near the wall... if you look hard enough.
Head straight west like an arrow when you leave, and you should find him; he and his archers are along the western wall, last I heard.
Damnable goblins!  Are you in need of healing?
All right, then.  By the Gods, if we live through this, I'm heading back south as soon as I can; I've seen enough of the North to last me the rest of my years.
Well done!  Thanks to you, we have made it through the day - and Targos still stands!
Of course - though this may be the last time you will see me.  I'm heading back south as soon as I can; I've seen enough of the North to last me the rest of my years.
Hmmph.  While I admit I don't care much for nature priests and their penniless ways... or even rangers in general... I wouldn't mind having a few more on our side right now.
All right, then.  By the Gods, if we live through this, I'm heading back south as soon as I can; I've seen enough of the North to last me the rest of my years.
Of course - though this may be the last time you will see me.  I'm heading back south as soon as I can; I've seen enough of the North to last me the rest of my years.
Who are you?
I don't know who you are, but I don't care much for your tone.  Maybe you better explain yourself *before* I lose my temper.
Very well.  Farewell.
Actually, I'm looking for the Commander of the Targos Guard.
No, I've got an assignment... I'm supposed to report to an engineer named Olap and help him, if I can.
No, I'm looking for Isherwood, one of the archer captains.
I could use some healing.
I could use some healing.
Your cloth marks you as a follower of the god of trade... and wealth.
So you're a priest?
Can you tell me anything of the goblin attacks?
What were you saying about nature priests and rangers before?
So Shawford ordered you to stay here?
I'll go see them, then.  Farewell.

Actually, I had some other questions instead.
Perhaps another time, then.  Farewell.
Do you have some sort of problem with nature worshippers?

I see.  I must take my leave.  Farewell.

Nature is indeed a powerful ally - and that spell is at my command.  Any other spells or charms you think are useful?

Yes.
Yes.
Not at the moment, no.  Remain here, we may need you in the fighting to come.
Not at the moment, no.  Remain here, we may need you in the fighting to come.
Can we have some healing?
Can we have some healing?
It was a close thing, but we prevailed.  Are you all right?
It was a close thing, but we prevailed.  Farewell, Nolan.
Why?
I could use some healing.
I could use some healing.
I had some other questions I wished to ask.
I see.  I must take my leave.  Farewell.
